text: [Music]
I I wouldn't call myself political first
of all novakov was very slly I think he
was far more political than than than he
let on um his deep hatred of that system
comes up he I never do what he did that
he wouldn't talk to Roman Jacobson
because he just traveled to Soviet Union
he wouldn't talk to people who who who
who even traveled or talked with the
Soviets you know he was that um but um
for me uh reading Lolita the the
political matters that come out there
are
existential if as a woman a writer a
teacher and a human being your core
values are being
assaulted you need to protect them and
if this is a political system then you
you have to confront it so for me and
and I think for many women in Iran they
didn't confront it
politically the more we were who we were
and that is why it makes me very close
to nabaka the more I was who I was the
more subversive I became in relation to
the
regime uh I they would tell you to wear
the veil um at first I refused it wasn't
a political statement it was a statement
about the fact that as VAV hav says in
the power of the powerless and Milos
says um in captive mind um these systems
try to turn you into a lie they try to
make you negate who you are so the
individual becomes a political entity
you know as an as a woman walking down
the streets and letting this much hair
down I would become a political sign you
know I couldn't help it um that is what
I wanted to try and say and and the
second thing I wanted to say in that
book and I on purpose chose writers that
were apolitical
James Austin Gatsby uh Fitzgerald
because I wanted to show the more a work
of literature was um faithful to
itself the more subversive it will
become of
society books with messages have the
same kind of mindset that tyrants have
they want to impose their message on you
it is books without
messages that genuinely subvert you and
make you think uh about politics uh that
was another message quote unquote
if if I should contradict myself um with
reading Lolita so I wouldn't call it
political but it's useless not for for
me to deny it because everybody would
call it political
